summary: This email from August 13, 2019, contains summaries of voluntary interviews conducted by OIG, FBI, and USAO-SDNY with MCC employees regarding the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death. It details failures in protocol, including Epstein being left without a cellmate and missed inmate counts, and notes that several officers refused to be interviewed without union representation.

persons.name: Lt. Jean
persons.context: Responded to the SHU on the morning of Epstein's death, saw Officer-ll who said Epstein had hung himself, entered the cell and performed CPR until medical staff arrived. Questioned Officer- about the missing cellmate.

persons.name: Officer-ll
persons.context: Reported to Lt. Jean that Epstein had hung himself. Was present in the SHU when Epstein's body was discovered.

connections.description: Lt. Jean was the supervising lieutenant who responded to Officer-ll's radio call reporting Epstein's hanging.
Lt. Jean questioned Officer- about why Epstein did not have a cellmate and about the failure to conduct inmate counts.

events.title: Discovery of Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). He was on the ground on top of two mattresses, and officers performed CPR.

events.title: Missed Inmate Counts and Cellmate Removal
events.description: Officers on duty failed to conduct the 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts. Epstein's cellmate was moved out, and Epstein was left without a cellmate overnight, contrary to protocol.

events.title: Voluntary Interviews of MCC Staff
events.description: OIG, FBI, and USAO-SDNY conducted approximately 2-hour voluntary interviews with several MCC employees regarding the events leading to Epstein's death.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his MCC cell on the morning of August 10, 2019, after an apparent suicide by hanging.
Epstein was left without a cellmate overnight on August 9-10, 2019, despite specific orders that he should have one at all times following a prior suicide attempt.
Officers on duty failed to conduct the mandatory 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts on the night of Epstein's death.
Several MCC officers refused to be interviewed by FBI and OIG agents without their union representatives present.
The camera system in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) where Epstein was held was not working at the time of his death.
